7.question: What does a solid red traffic signal light mean?

options.text: STOP until a green light appears
Slow down and proceed with caution
options.explanation: A solid red light means you must come to a complete stop, not slow down.

options.text: Stop only if other vehicles are present
options.explanation: You must stop at a solid red light regardless of whether other vehicles are present.

options.text: Yield to oncoming traffic
options.explanation: A solid red light requires a complete stop, not just yielding.

7.question: When can you make a right turn at a red light?

options.text: After stopping completely, if there is no 'No Turn On Red' sign and it is safe
Without stopping if no vehicles are coming
options.explanation: You must come to a complete stop before turning right on red.

options.text: Only when a green arrow appears
options.explanation: A green arrow indicates a protected turn; right turns on red are allowed after stopping if not prohibited by signs.

options.text: Never, it's always illegal
options.explanation: Right turns on red are legal after stopping completely unless specifically prohibited.

7.question: What does a flashing yellow arrow at an intersection mean?

options.text: You can turn but your turn is not protected from other traffic
You must come to a complete stop before turning
options.explanation: A flashing yellow arrow does not require you to stop, but to yield to oncoming traffic.

options.text: You have the right-of-way over all other traffic
options.explanation: A flashing yellow arrow means your turn is not protected and you must yield.

options.text: Pedestrians have the right-of-way only
options.explanation: While you must yield to pedestrians, you must also yield to oncoming vehicles.

7.question: When a traffic light is not working, how should you proceed through the intersection?

options.text: Stop as if the intersection is controlled by STOP signs in all directions
Proceed without stopping if no other vehicles are present
options.explanation: You must treat a non-functioning traffic light as an all-way stop.

options.text: Yield to vehicles on your right only
options.explanation: You must first stop completely, then follow right-of-way rules.

options.text: Drive through quickly to clear the intersection
options.explanation: Speeding through a non-functioning traffic light intersection is dangerous and illegal.

7.question: What does a flashing DON'T WALK or flashing raised hand pedestrian signal mean?

options.text: Do not start crossing the street
Cross the street quickly
options.explanation: A flashing DON'T WALK signal indicates you should not begin crossing.

options.text: Return to the sidewalk immediately
options.explanation: If you've already started crossing, you should continue to the other side.

options.text: Pedestrians must yield to all vehicles
options.explanation: Drivers must still yield to pedestrians already in the crosswalk, even when the signal is flashing.

7.question: At an intersection with no STOP or YIELD signs, who has the right-of-way?

options.text: The vehicle that arrives at the intersection first
The vehicle on the right always has the right-of-way
options.explanation: The vehicle on the right only has right-of-way if both vehicles arrive at the same time.

options.text: The vehicle traveling faster
options.explanation: Speed does not determine right-of-way at intersections.

options.text: The vehicle traveling on the wider road
options.explanation: The size of the road doesn't determine right-of-way at uncontrolled intersections.

7.question: What should you do when entering a roundabout?

options.text: Yield to all traffic already in the roundabout
Enter at full speed to merge with traffic
options.explanation: You should slow down as you approach a roundabout and yield to traffic already in it.

options.text: Stop completely before entering
options.explanation: Roundabouts require yielding, not stopping, unless necessary for safety.

options.text: Vehicles on the right have the right-of-way
options.explanation: Traffic already in the roundabout has the right-of-way, regardless of direction.

7.question: When is it legal to pass on the right?

options.text: When the vehicle ahead is turning left and there is room to pass safely on the right
Only when driving on a multilane highway
options.explanation: Passing on the right is also legal when the vehicle ahead is turning left.

options.text: Only when the vehicle ahead is moving slower than the speed limit
options.explanation: Speed difference alone doesn't make passing on the right legal.

options.text: Never, it is always illegal to pass on the right
options.explanation: Passing on the right is legal in certain situations, including when a vehicle ahead is turning left.

7.question: What should you do if a pedestrian with a white cane or guide dog is crossing the street?

options.text: Always yield the right-of-way
Honk your horn to alert them of your presence
options.explanation: Do not honk at blind pedestrians as it may confuse or disorient them.

options.text: Proceed if they are not in a crosswalk
options.explanation: Blind pedestrians with white canes or guide dogs have the right-of-way at all times.

options.text: Drive around them quickly
options.explanation: This is dangerous and fails to yield the right-of-way to the blind pedestrian.

7.question: What does a 5-sided sign indicate?

options.text: School zone
Railroad crossing
options.explanation: Railroad crossings are marked with round or X-shaped signs.

options.text: Construction area
options.explanation: Construction areas are typically marked with orange diamond-shaped signs.

options.text: Hospital zone
options.explanation: Hospital zones are not indicated by 5-sided signs.

7.question: What is the speed limit in a school zone when children are present?

options.text: 25 mph
35 mph
options.explanation: The speed limit in a school zone when children are present is 25 mph, not 35 mph.

options.text: 15 mph only when children are crossing
options.explanation: While some school zones may have 15 mph limits, the standard is 25 mph when children are present.

options.text: The posted speed limit does not change
options.explanation: The speed limit is reduced to 25 mph in school zones when children are present.

7.question: When two vehicles meet on a steep narrow road and neither vehicle can pass, which vehicle has the right-of-way?

options.text: The vehicle facing uphill
The vehicle facing downhill
options.explanation: The vehicle facing uphill has the right-of-way because it's more difficult to back up a hill.

options.text: The vehicle that arrived first
options.explanation: On steep narrow roads, the vehicle facing uphill has the right-of-way regardless of arrival time.

options.text: The vehicle with more passengers
options.explanation: The number of passengers does not determine right-of-way on steep narrow roads.

7.question: What should you do when you see a school bus with flashing red lights ahead of you?

options.text: Stop from either direction until the children are safely across and the lights stop flashing
Slow down and proceed with caution
options.explanation: You must stop completely when a school bus has flashing red lights, not just slow down.

options.text: Stop only if you're behind the bus
options.explanation: You must stop from either direction unless on a divided highway.

options.text: Pass quickly before children exit
options.explanation: This is extremely dangerous and illegal. You must stop when a school bus has flashing red lights.

7.question: What is the speed limit at a blind intersection with no posted speed limit sign?

options.text: 15 mph
25 mph
options.explanation: The speed limit at a blind intersection is 15 mph, not 25 mph.

options.text: 35 mph
options.explanation: The speed limit at a blind intersection is 15 mph, not 35 mph.

options.text: The default speed limit for the type of road

7.question: What does a double solid yellow line in the center of the road mean?

options.text: Do not pass or cross over except in specific situations like turning left into a driveway
Passing is allowed when safe
options.explanation: Double solid yellow lines prohibit passing from either direction.

options.text: Only vehicles in the left lane may pass
options.explanation: Double solid yellow lines prohibit passing from either direction.

options.text: No left turns allowed under any circumstances
options.explanation: Left turns across double yellow lines are permitted in specific situations like entering driveways.

7.question: When should you use your headlights?

options.text: 30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise, and when visibility is poor
Only when driving at night
options.explanation: Headlights are also required during poor visibility, foggy conditions, and when using windshield wipers in rain.

options.text: Only when you cannot see other vehicles
options.explanation: Headlights should be used during specific times and conditions, not just when you can't see others.

options.text: Whenever you want other drivers to see you
options.explanation: While headlights help others see you, they're required at specific times and in specific conditions.

7.question: What must you do when you hear a siren and see emergency vehicle lights behind you?

options.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle passes
Speed up to get out of the way
options.explanation: Speeding up can be dangerous and interfere with emergency response.

options.text: Stop immediately where you are
options.explanation: You should pull to the right edge of the road, not stop in your current lane.

options.text: Move to the left lane to allow passing on the right
options.explanation: You should move to the right edge of the road, not to the left lane.

7.question: What is the minimum safe distance to maintain when passing a bicyclist?

options.text: At least three feet
At least one foot
options.explanation: One foot is not enough space to safely pass a bicyclist; three feet is the minimum.

options.text: At least six feet
options.explanation: While more space is better, the legal minimum is three feet.

options.text: There is no minimum distance requirement

7.question: At a T-intersection with no signs or signals, who has the right-of-way?

options.text: Traffic traveling on the through road
Traffic turning right from the terminating road

options.text: Traffic turning left from the terminating road
options.explanation: At a T-intersection, vehicles on the through road have the right-of-way.

options.text: The vehicle that arrives first

7.question: When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing red lights, what should you do?

options.text: Stop at least 15 feet from the nearest track and wait until the lights stop flashing
Slow down, look both ways, and cross carefully
options.explanation: Flashing red lights at a railroad crossing require a complete stop.

options.text: Quickly cross the tracks if no train is visible

options.text: Stop only if the crossing gate is lowered
